definition[0]: the crime of using a card reader (=machine that checks the details on a credit card or debit card) to get private information about someoneâ€™s credit card  in order to steal money from them
definition[1]: when a company charges a very high price for a new product in order to make as large a profit as possible before competing products appear on the market and force the company to lower the price
definition[2]: when a person or company cheats the tax authorities by not telling them about some of the profit that has been made
example[0]: a dispute over alleged profit skimming
